results.title: Ischemia-induced norepinephrine release, but not norepinephrine-derived free radicals, contributes to myocardial ischemia-reperfusion injury.
results.text_hl: During the @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Occlusion</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054059 @@@coronary occlusion@@@, concentrations of interstitial NE increased markedly in the control and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ groups, but was unchanged in the @CHEMICAL_Phenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019800 @@@phenol@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Nonomura M, Nozawa T, Matsuki A, Nakadate T, Igarashi N, Kato B, Fujii N, Igawa A, Asanoi H, Kondo T, Inoue H. Ischemia-induced norepinephrine release, but not norepinephrine-derived free radicals, contributes to myocardial ischemia-reperfusion injury. Circ J. 2005 May;69(5):590-5. PMID: 15849447

results.title: Differences in ischaemic myocardial potassium leakage after treatment with the calcium antagonist anipamil or the beta-blocker atenolol.
results.text_hl: The abilities of the new @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ antagonist @CHEMICAL_anipamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:C045313 @@@anipamil@@@ as well as the beta-blocker @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ to reduce the amount of K+ released into the extracellular space during the first minutes of acute @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Occlusion</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054059 @@@coronary artery occlusion@@@ were investigated in anaesthetized @SPECIES_9823 @@@pigs@@@.

citations.NLM: Kirchengast M. Differences in ischaemic myocardial potassium leakage after treatment with the calcium antagonist anipamil or the beta-blocker atenolol. Arzneimittelforschung. 1990 Aug;40(8):868-71. PMID: 2242078

results.title: Complex adrenergic and inflammatory mechanisms contribute to phase 2 ventricular arrhythmias in anaesthetized rats.
results.text_hl: EXPERIMENTAL APPROACH: Neutrophil-replete Sprague-Dawley @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ (n = 8-9 per group) were anaesthetized and randomized to receive vehicle, @CHEMICAL_Prazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011224 @@@prazosin@@@ (0.5 mg.kg(-1) i.v.), @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (4 mg.kg(-1) i.v.) or their combination prior to left main @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Occlusion</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054059 @@@coronary artery occlusion@@@.

citations.NLM: Clements-Jewery H, Andrag E, Hearse DJ, Curtis MJ. Complex adrenergic and inflammatory mechanisms contribute to phase 2 ventricular arrhythmias in anaesthetized rats. Br J Pharmacol. 2009 Feb;156(3):444-53. PMID: 19154442
citations.BibTeX: @article{19154442, title={Complex adrenergic and inflammatory mechanisms contribute to phase 2 ventricular arrhythmias in anaesthetized rats.}, author={Clements-Jewery H and Andrag E and Hearse DJ and Curtis MJ}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={156}, number={3}, pages={444-53}}

results.title: Amelioration of cardiac remodeling in congestive heart failure by beta-adrenoceptor blockade is associated with depression in sympathetic activity.
results.text_hl: Three weeks after @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Occlusion</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054059 @@@occlusion of the coronary artery@@@, @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were treated daily with 20 and 75 mg/kg of either @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ for 5 weeks.

citations.NLM: Machackova J, Sanganalmath SK, Barta J, Dhalla KS, Dhalla NS. Amelioration of cardiac remodeling in congestive heart failure by beta-adrenoceptor blockade is associated with depression in sympathetic activity. Cardiovasc Toxicol. 2010 Mar;10(1):9-16. PMID: 19949891
